background.text: 1] This is second bail application filed by the accused namely, Bembatya (accused no.4) with request to grant him bail, u/s. 439 of the Code of Criminal Procedure-1973 against whom Crime No. 457 of 2018, is registered in the Baramati City police station (District â€“ Pune ), for having committed offence punishable U/ss. 395, 364A, 386, 504, 506 of I.P.C and 39 of Maharashtra Money Lending Act. First bail application was filed before filing of the charge-sheet.

legalActFound.stringMatched: u/s. 439 of the code of criminal procedure

arguments.text: 2] It is case of the prosecution that incident took place between 5/7/2018 to 28/8/2018. It is prosecution case, on 5/7/2018 informant obtained Rs.30,000/- from some of the accused. Demand of the excessive interest was made for that he agreed under compelling circumstances. Thereafter he paid interest to the accused. Even thereafter on 14/8/2018 some of the accused came and asked amount. They also beat informant and threatened so he left the house and started residing at Pirangut.

argumentSentences.text: 2] It is case of the prosecution that incident took place between 5/7/2018 to 28/8/2018.
It is prosecution case, on 5/7/2018 informant obtained Rs.30,000/- from some of the accused.
Demand of the excessive interest was made for that he agreed under compelling circumstances.
Thereafter he paid interest to the accused.
Even thereafter on 14/8/2018 some of the accused came and asked amount.
They also beat informant and threatened so he left the house and started residing at Pirangut.

arguments.text: 3] On 28/8/2018 the accused visited house of the informant. applicant-accused was armed with sickle. All the accused entered in the house and took search, when wife of the informant Vaishali intervening the scuffle, accused beat her. It is prosecution case, during the incident applicant-accused at the point of sickle, snatched away golden ornaments (Ganthan). Other accused took away cow belonged to informant.

Other accused took away cow belonged to informant.

arguments.text: 4] It is case of prosecution that on getting information of the offence, case is registered against the present applicant-accused and others.

arguments.text: 5] Learned advocate Mr. A.B. Gaikwad appearing for the accused submitted arguments in the line of application filed. He further submitted, charge-sheet is submitted in the trial court.

He also submitted, charge-sheet is submitted in the trial Court.

arguments.text: 7] I have given anxious thought to the arguments advanced on behalf of both the sides.

argumentSentences.text: 7] I have given anxious thought to the arguments advanced on behalf of both the sides.

arguments.text: 8] Nature of the offence alleged to have committed by the accused is serious. Evidence collected by the prosecution indicates involvement of the applicant-accused in the commission of crime.

argumentSentences.text: 8] Nature of the offence alleged to have committed by the accused is serious.
Evidence collected by the prosecution indicates involvement of the applicant-accused in the commission of crime.

arguments.text: 9] Same time it cannot be overlooked objection taken on behalf of the prosecution are mainly accused would put pressure upon the witnesses and that it would become very difficult to secure his presence at the time of trial.

argumentSentences.text: 9] Same time it cannot be overlooked objection taken on behalf of the prosecution are mainly accused would put pressure upon the witnesses and that it would become very difficult to secure his presence at the time of trial.

arguments.text: 10] In my opinion, care of the objections taken on behalf of the prosecution can be taken putting stringent conditions upon the applicant-accused and in given circumstances, it would not be proper to keep the accused behind the bar for indefinite. [11] In the result, following order is passed :-

argumentSentences.text: 10] In my opinion, care of the objections taken on behalf of the prosecution can be taken putting stringent conditions upon the applicant-accused and in given circumstances, it would not be proper to keep the accused behind the bar for indefinite.
[11] In the result, following order is passed :-

order.text: ORDER i] Bail application is allowed. ii] Accused Bembatya (accused no.4) be released on bail on execution of P.B. of Rs.30,000/- with solvent surety in the like amount. iii] Accused not to misuse the liberty given. iv] Accused to submit legally acceptable identity and address proof. v] Applicant accused to visit police station till conclusion of trial on the 1st day of each month. vi] Bail before concerned J. M. F. C. till committal of the case and thereafter before the Court to whom case is assigned. Accordingly, order is passed and Bail Application stands disposed of.

processedText:
1 Cri. Bail Appln. No.9/2019 ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 MHPU14-000044-2019 
---header-ends---
1] This is second bail application filed by the accused namely, Bembatya (accused no.4) with request to grant him bail, u/s. 439 of the Code of Criminal Procedure-1973 against whom Crime No. 457 of 2018, is registered in the Baramati City police station (District â€“ Pune ), for having committed offence punishable U/ss. 395, 364A, 386, 504, 506 of I.P.C and 39 of Maharashtra Money Lending Act. First bail application was filed before filing of the charge-sheet. 
---background-ends---
2] It is case of the prosecution that incident took place between 5/7/2018 to 28/8/2018. It is prosecution case, on 5/7/2018 informant obtained Rs.30,000/- from some of the accused. Demand of the excessive interest was made for that he agreed under compelling circumstances. Thereafter he paid interest to the accused. Even thereafter on 14/8/2018 some of the accused came and asked amount. They also beat informant and threatened so he left the house and started residing at Pirangut. 
---argument-ends---
3] On 28/8/2018 the accused visited house of the informant. applicant-accused was armed with sickle. All the accused entered in the house and took search, when wife of the informant Vaishali intervening the scuffle, accused beat her. It is prosecution case, during the incident applicant-accused at the point of sickle, snatched away golden ornaments (Ganthan). Other accused took away cow belonged to informant. 
---argument-ends---
4] It is case of prosecution that on getting information of the offence, case is registered against the present applicant-accused and others. 
---argument-ends---
5] Learned advocate Mr. A.B. Gaikwad appearing for the accused submitted arguments in the line of application filed. He further submitted, charge-sheet is submitted in the trial court. 
---argument-ends---
6] Per contra, learned APP Mr. Joshi submitted arguments in the line of say submitted by the prosecution. He also submitted, charge-sheet is submitted in the trial Court. 
---argument-ends---
7] I have given anxious thought to the arguments advanced on behalf of both the sides. 
---argument-ends---
8] Nature of the offence alleged to have committed by the accused is serious. Evidence collected by the prosecution indicates involvement of the applicant-accused in the commission of crime. 
---argument-ends---
9] Same time it cannot be overlooked objection taken on behalf of the prosecution are mainly accused would put pressure upon the witnesses and that it would become very difficult to secure his presence at the time of trial. 
---argument-ends---
10] In my opinion, care of the objections taken on behalf of the prosecution can be taken putting stringent conditions upon the applicant-accused and in given circumstances, it would not be proper to keep the accused behind the bar for indefinite. [11] In the result, following order is passed :- 
---argument-ends---
ORDER i] Bail application is allowed. ii] Accused Bembatya (accused no.4) be released on bail on execution of P.B. of Rs.30,000/- with solvent surety in the like amount. iii] Accused not to misuse the liberty given. iv] Accused to submit legally acceptable identity and address proof. v] Applicant accused to visit police station till conclusion of trial on the 1st day of each month. vi] Bail before concerned J. M. F. C. till committal of the case and thereafter before the Court to whom case is assigned. Accordingly, order is passed and Bail Application stands disposed of. 
---order-ends---
Baramati ( R.B. Deshpande) 21.1.2019 Addl. Sessions Judge, Baramati. CERTIFICATE â€œ I affirm that the contents of this PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment.
